SHORT_DESCR.P: Supplier engagement event — 21.3.2018 and 22.3.2018 at Companies House Cardiff.

Legal&Risk aims to deliver work efficiencies through investment in a modern integrated legal case management IT system, exploiting opportunities to automate and modernise, producing easier systems use with less “steps” between systems and more intuitive user interface, helping legal staff become more effective in their roles to focus on their critical work elements and less on administrative tasks.
Key features which are of interest to us include:
4. Staff clocking in/out and flexible working management (preferably compatible with NHS Wales’ online provider ESR and/or and existing NWSSP swipe card system);
5. Contacts management (client organisations, client human contacts, experts, service providers (expert ratings), courts, solicitor firms, individual solicitors, defence unions, others;

6. Case synopsis, evidence and strategy information (for all work types – NB clinical negligence, personal injury, putting things right, inquests, employment, commercial, procurement, NHS Regulatory, Court of Protection/mental capacity/health act, commercial property, general advisory, data protection and information governance;
7. Case diary management (including litigation pre and in court proceedings);

8. Matter financial information (including hourly rates, court rates, costs budgeting processes, damages, costs, disbursements, compensation recovery unit liabilities, payments made and pending) cashflow analysis and management;
9. Matter time recording (varying hourly rates where required);
10. Matter task/workflow management, allocation and automation;
11. Document management (linking to cases/matters, managing email/document generation, template generation (compatible with voice recognition), meta-data and storage);
12. Management of periodical payments and lump sums to claimants;
13. Compatibility with client software enabling auto upload to us of New and up-dated case data (currently they use Datix but this is under review);
14. Web-based front-end (browser agnostic), enabling secure All-Wales client access to some reporting functions;
15. Matter file review, audit and reporting (including KPI’s) on all of the above;

L&R is a division of the NHS Wales Shared Services Partnership, hosted by Velindre NHS Trust.

L&R undertakes legal representation and provides in-house/shared services legal advice across a range of complex issues, for all of the NHS bodies in Wales (Local Health Boards and NHS Trusts). L&R has specialist experience, knowledge and understanding of the legal, administrative and policy issues that affect the operation of the NHS in Wales. A large proportion of L&R’s work involves the management of currently 2700 ongoing clinical negligence claims and around 700 personal injury claims. In addition we have a team of employment, commercial, property and lawyers advising on complex patient care. We also handle inquests and provide a general advisory service to the Welsh NHS, dealing with around 800 such requests a year.

L&R currently employs 103 members of staff based at our offices in Cardiff, ranging through solicitors, trainee solicitors, paralegals, secretarial and administrative staff, and a business manager. L&R also manages the Welsh Risk Pool (WRP), consisting of a team of 6 staff who are based in North Wales.

The majority of L&R’s staff spend most of their time working within the main offices in Cardiff. A large number of staff (mainly solicitors) work remotely, either on a regular or ad hoc basis, from home, other NHS premises or at various court premises across Wales and England. L&R’s Cardiff office is based at the NWSSP South East Regional Centre, located at Companies House in Cardiff.

L&R’s main IT support is provided by NWIS, including IT network, desktop support, management of servers, email accounts and remote access via VPN. The desktop environment is Windows based, operating Microsoft Office 2007 (soon to move to 2016). Currently an independent single-handed developer provides and supports our bespoke Microsoft Access legal case management system. L&R uses Big-hand digital dictation integrated with nuance/dragon voice recognition software. Digital document management and communication software is provided by virtual cabinet.

The demands of a high workload in the context of a limited/capped (highly skilled) professional services team is a key driver for the case for change. L&R aims to deliver work efficiencies through investment in a modern integrated legal case management IT system, exploiting opportunities to automate and modernise, producing easier systems use with less “steps” between systems and more intuitive user interface, helping legal staff become more effective in their roles to focus on their critical work elements and less on administrative tasks.
